SUBJECT: Z--Repair/Replace damaged driveways & walkays
CONTACT: Auerbach, Jody
DESC:
The Department of the Interior, National Park Services, Gloria Dei National Historic Site, Philadelphia, PA intends to issue a Request for Proposal, 140P4219R0012 to repair or replace damaged driveways and walkways, install ADA crosswalk ramps, paint fencing and signs, repair existing brick walls and remove and install new trees and plantings. The work includes providing all labor, materials, tools, equipment, supplies, transportation and supervision to complete this work. The project is being solicited as a total hub-zone set-aside.  The solicitation including all bid documents, will be posted to the websites: http://www.fedbizopps.gov and https://www.fdconnect.net on or about July 15, 2019.  Hard copies of the solicitation will not be mailed.  To receive the solicitation package you must download it from one of the above sites.  It is therefore the contractors responsibility to check the internet site daily for any posted changes to the solicitation.  Contractors must be registered in SAM, System for Award Management in order to receive a contract award.  The North American Industry Classification System Code (NAICS) is 238910, Site Preparation Contractors with a size standard of $15M.  
The magnitude for this project is between $500,000 and $1,000,000 and is subject to the Davis Bacon Act.  A Bid Guarantee will be required with the solicitation; Payment and Performance Bonds will be required within 10 days of award.  There will be a site visit scheduled and perspective offerors are encouraged to visit the site to review conditions before providing an offer.  The date and time for the site visit will be specified in the solicitation. 
For questions concerning this project contact Jody Auerbach, telephone 267.528.1416 or via email: jody_auerbach@nps.gov.

OFFADD: N61340 Naval Air Warfare Center Training Systems Division 12211 Science Drive  Orlando, FL
SUBJECT: J--Fleet Readiness Center East (FRC-E) Depot Level Maintenance
CONTACT: Rebecca Woods 407-380-4948 Rebecca Woods, Contract Specialist, 407-380-4948 or Alan Arblaster, Contracting Officer, 407-380-8170
DESC:
The Naval Air Warfare Center, Training Systems Division (NAWCTSD) in Orlando, FL has a follow-on requirement for Depot Level Maintenance (DLM) in support of Fleet Readiness Center Southeast (FRCSE) aboard Naval Air Station (NAS) Jacksonville, FL and it remote sites, which include Naval Station (NS) Mayport, FL; Cecil Commerce Center (Cecil Field) in Jacksonville, FL; and FRCSE Detachments at NAS Oceana, VA and NS Norfolk, VA.  (Tinker AFB is also a potential future site for these services.) The requirement provides for mechanic and artisan labor to perform maintenance actions on aircraft, aircraft engines and associated components/materials undergoing DLM.  The required services also include modernization, conversion, in-service repair, disassembly, and all other categories of aircraft DLM.
 The types of aircraft and associated aircraft components requiring DLM include, but are not limited to, the following: EA-6B, F/A-18, H-60, P-3, P-8, E-2, C-2, S-3, T-6, T-34, T-44 and T-45.

A single award Cost Plus Fixed Fee (CPFF) Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract with a four-year ordering period is anticipated.  

This procurement is a competitive 8(a) small business set-aside. 

The PSC code is J015 and the NAICS code is 336411. 

A DRAFT copy of the solicitation is included with this posting.

The final RFP is anticipated to be issued on 10 December 2018 and the pre-proposal conference is anticipated to be held on 12 December 2018. Specific guidance concerning visit request requirements to attend the pre-proposal conference is also provided in Section L.
 An update to this synopsis is anticipated to be issued next week to confirm the dates for issuing the final RFP and holding the pre-proposal conference.

374th Contracting Squadron is seeking the interest of potential and eligible contractors in Integrated Solid Waste management Contract at Yokota Air Base and Geographically Separated Units.

Services shall be performed in accordance with (IAW) Yokota Air Base Recycling Program, applicable Japanese laws and pertinent regulations, and commercial practices.

The period of performance is anticipated to be for a seven-month basic period with six (6) year options fot total of six (6) year and seven (7) months.

All responsible sources may submit a proposal that shall be considered by this Agency. Interested contractors are encouraged to submit their contact information by registering as an interested vendor utilizing the Vendor Notification Service link within the Register to Receive Notification function of Fed Biz Ops https://www.fbo.gov/.

Please refer to SF1449 for more information on site visits and evaluation procedures.

NOTE: THIS PROJECT WILL BE PERFORMED IN ITS ENTIRETY IN THE COUNTRY OF JAPAN. THE SUCCESSFUL OFFER MUST BE LICENSED AND REGISTERED TO PERFORM THE SERVICE IN THE COUNTRY OF JAPAN.

SUBJECT: Examining Post-Exposure Prophylaxis (PEP) recommendations for Burkholderia pseudomallei in the goat animal model
CONTACT: Lee Catherine Kennedy, Contract Specialist, Phone 770-488-2673, Email vhg0@cdc.gov
DESC:
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) intends to award a fixed-price contract on a sole source basis to College of Veterinary Medicine and Bioscience at Colorado State University (CSU), Fort Collins, CO for caprine animal research model for use in testing aerosol infection and percutaneous infections in goats to model human disease. CSU is the only known institution that conducts BSL3 research studies using goats and Burkholderia pseudomal/ei. Working with Burkholderia pseudomallei (classified by the U.S Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) and the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) as a Tier 1 Select Agent) requires select agent certification and BSL-3 laboratory space. CSU is the only known institution with all requisite certifications to work with the proposed model and pathogen. CSU is the only known institution and laboratory with proper approved Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and biosafety protocols approved and in place to conduct the work in the Government's requirement. Drafting and acquiring approval of biosafety protocols and gaining proper Select Agent clearances by another laboratory to conduct this work would add more than a year to the timeline of the project and would unnecessarily delay the Government's preparedness work for Burkholderia pseudomal/ei. The North American Industry Classification System Code (NAICS) for this requirement is 54171 with a size standard of 1,000 employees. This contract action is for supplies or services for which the Government intends to solicit and negotiate with only one source under the authority of FAR Part FAR 13.106-1 (b) and 10 U.S.C. 2304 (c) (1). Interested persons may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement or submit proposals.

This Notice of Intent is not a request for competitive quotations; however, all quotations/responses received within sixteen (16) calendar days of the issuance of this notice will be considered by the Government. A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed contract based upon responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government. Information received will be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement. Any quotation/response should be emailed to the Contracting Officer, Lee Catherine Kennedy, at vhg0@cdc.gov by 10:00am ET, Tuesday, 16 July 2019.
POPADDRESS: All work will be performed at the Contractor's facilities.

DESC:
DESCRIPTION

This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested, and a separate written solicitation shall not be issued.

This solicitation is a Request for Quote (RFQ) using FAR Parts 12 and 13 procedures. The solicitation document and incorporated provisions and clauses are those in effect through Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2019-01. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for the proposed acquisition is 334516, Analytical Laboratory Instrument Manufacturing. Business size standard of 500 employees. The solicitation is intended for full and open competition.

SUPPLIES OR SERVICES AND PRICES/COSTS

FDA requires an upgrade to an existing Agilent 1260 Infinity Series II HPLC system into a HPLC-single-quad-MS system with the intent of characterizing nucleic acid sequence impurities through exact mass measurements of each nucleic acid sequence impurity eluting from the HPLC column. The nucleic acid sequence impurities to be analyzed include but are not limited to shorter than full length native or modified DNA or RNA sequences, phosphorothioate DNA or RNA sequences and uncharged nucleic acids including peptide nucleic acid (PNA) and phosphorodiamidate morpholino (PMO) sequences. The instrument shall also be used to identify and characterize routine and modified deoxyribonucleosides and ribonucleosides that are needed for the chemical synthesis of nucleic acid-based drugs.


CLIN DESCRIPTION PRICE
0001 HPLC Upgrade $
Installation $
S&H $

Total Cost $

REQUIREMENTS

The following add-on instruments/parts (Agilent part number listed below) are required for the configuration of an Agilent LC-MS system; salient, physical, functional, or performance characteristics of the add-on instruments/parts which "equal" products shall meet are also listed:

1. The add-on MS system shall be compatible with a single-point control software that has full control of the existing Agilent 1260 Infinity Series II HPLC system and the MS system
2. Liquid chromatograph/mass selective detector (LC/MSD ) (G6125BA):
• mass range 2-2,000 m/z
• selected ion monitoring (SIM) sensitivity at electrospray ionization (ESI) positive mode: 1 pg of reserpine injected on column, quantifying the m/z 609 ion with signal-to-noise (STN) ratio RMS >100:1
• SIM sensitivity at atmospheric pressure chemical ionization (APCI) positive mode: 1 pg of reserpine injected on column, quantifying the m/z 609 ion with STN ratio RMS >30:1;
• Maximum scan speed: 10,400 u/sec (Da/sec)
• Switching time from positive to negative polarity: 300 msec
• Mass resolution for full width at half maximum: Unit resolution ≤ 0.7 u (Da)
• Mass stability (drift): over 12 hours ≤ 0.1 u (Da) or 100 ppm, whichever is larger
• Mass accuracy: ±0.005 u (Da)
• Spectral accuracy: 99.0%
• Dynamic range: > 6 × 106 (electronic)
• Agilent LC/MSD for OpenLAB CDS ChemStation Edition
• Includes an AP-ESI Ion Source, an OpenLAB CDS ChemStation Edition software, and MS Connection (G6125BA)
• Compatible and comes with drivers to support the existing Agilent 1260 Infinity Series II HPLC system

3. Multicolumn Thermostat MCT (G7116A) shallstack with the existing Agilent 1260 Infinity Series II and come with valve drive. Supports temperatures from 10C below ambient to 110C
4. Two-position, 6 port switching valve (G4231A) shallfit into MCT above that stacks with existing Agilent modules

5. Quick Connect Assy ST 0.12x150mm (5067-5958) InfinityLab Quick Connect Assy ST 0.12mm x 150mm includes 1x Quick Connect fitting, 1x Quick Connect capillary, 1x Swagelock fitting

6. PEAK Nitrogen Generator System (G1953A, option 004).
• Gas flow: 32 L/min
• Outlet pressure: 100 psi
• Noise level: 54 dB(A) @1m
• Particles: < 0.01 µm
• Offered with a 110V plug

SHIPPING/INSTALLATION/TRAINING/SUPPORT

• Shall deliver 2 days of on-site consulting for the total solution of existing 1260 Infinity Series II system configured with new single quad mass spec (H2149A, option 002)

• Shipping, installation, familiarization and on-site training

• Manufacturer's 1-year Warranty

CONTACT: Robin Knightly, Contract Specialist, Phone 3018275302, Email robin.knightly@nih.gov - Valerie Whipple, Contracting Officer, Phone 301-827-5218, Email Valerie.whipple@nih.gov
DESC:
This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items, prepared in accordance with format in FAR 12.6 as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation and a separate written solicitation will not be issued. This solicitation: No. NIMH-19-004845 includes all applicable provisions and clauses in effect through FAR Federal Acquisition Circular (FAC) 2019-1 simplified procedures for commercial items. This acquisition will be conducted under the procedures for acquiring commercial items authorized in FAR Part 12 and under the authority to use simplified procedures for commercial requirements as provided in FAR 13.501.

This requirement is assigned North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code 334516 with a size standard of 1000 Employees is being considered.
Only one award will be made because of this solicitation. This will be awarded as a firm fixed price type contract.
BACKGROUND

The NIMH is the Federal agency responsible for conducting and supporting research on the brain and mental disorders. This research brings hope and effective treatments to the millions of people who suffer from mental disorders, which also benefit their families and friends. Thus, communicating research through distribution of NIMH printed materials provides information to the public and to the professionals who provide for their care.
Imaging the distribution of a fluorescent label in brain tissue sections is an essential step for experiments that are being carried out by many basic science investigators within the NIMH intramural program. In order to better preserve the morphology of tissue, it is often necessary to section it coarsely (>1mm) and then optically clear it. The resulting large sections of cleared tissue require many hours or days of imaging on a conventional confocal microscope. Using a light sheet microscope however, reduces the acquisition time to minutes - dramatically accelerating an experimental pipeline. One such light sheet microscope (DISPIM) already exists in AIM and is currently being used to image live or fixed/cleared samples - each of which require a different configuration of the microscope. NIMH is funding the construction of a partial clone of this microscope dedicated for cleared tissue imaging (CT-DISPIM) on which NIMH users would receive priority. The CT-DISPIM is capable of volumetric acquisition from 1-10mm scale tissue samples within minutes with a spatial resolution adequate to trace neurites. Using an illumination source with several different wavelengths that can be independently triggered and modulated allows the microscope to image multiple labels in the same sample, greatly increasing the information content that can be obtained from a single sample. The combination of high speed, high volume, high content, and high resolution will be enabling for a variety of projects, including: mapping of injection sites when stereological injections are performed as part of functional opto- or chemo-genetic experiments, mapping projections as part of studies defining the connections of specific neuronal populations, and quantifying changes in gene expression in behavior paradigms.

NIMH and the trans-NIH Advanced Imaging and Microscopy (AIM) Resource are working together to build a dualview selective plane illumination microscope dedicated to rapidly imaging large samples of chemically cleared brain tissue (CT-DISPIM). This microscope is a modified clone of an existing system at AIM and requires an illumination source - a set of 4 lasers with different wavelengths, each with >100mW power, that can be individually triggered and modulated by our existing control systems. The existing microscope uses a Coherent OBIS Laser Box as its illumination source, therefore a Coherent OBIS Laser Box or "equal" laser box is required to clone the microscope. Any laser box or lasers that are not compatible with the modified dualview selective plane illumination microscope will not be considered.
The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, National Institutes of Health, National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH), plans to procure the following Coherent OBIS Laser Box and Lasers or "equal" laser box and lasers:
1. OBIS 405nm LX 100mW laser;
2. OBIS 488nm LX 150mW laser;
3. OBIS 561nm LS 150mW laser;
4. OBIS 637nm LX 140mW laser;
5. 5 bay OBIS laser box with Power Supply and USA Power Cord.

Any laser box or lasers that are not compatible with the modified dualview selective plane illumination microscope will not be considered.
The salient characteristics that apply to this acquisition are as follows:
The four laser system must have the following characteristics:

1. 4 independent, swappable diode lasers with wavelengths 405nm, 488nm, 561nm, and 637nm;
2. The power of all laser lines are 100mW or greater;
3. Each laser line can me modulated via digital trigger and analogue power modulation;
4. All control is via ASI DISPIM plugin on Micromangager;
5. Compatible with existing control software and hardware;
6. Spatial mode TEM00;
7. Pointing stability <30 urad over 2 hours;
8. Power stability <2% over 8 hours;
9. RMS noise <0.25% from 20Hz to 20MHz;
10. Polarization ratio >100:1 vertical; and
11. Digital modulation depth >1,000,000:1 at 0Hz, rise/fall time <1msec.


1. Quantity: 1 Multi-laser box system

Delivery Date: July 15, 2019 or 30 days from the award of the contract whichever is earliest.

PAYMENT

Payment shall be made upon the delivery and acceptance of all required items in accord with the Prompt Payment Act.
DELIVERY / INSTALLATION

The Contractor shall deliver and install the required item(s) within 30 days of purchase order award to the following location:

OFFERS FOR A LASER BOX OR LASERS THAT ARE NOT COMPATIBLE WITH THE MODIFIED DUALVIEW SELECTIVE PLANE ILLUMINATION MICROSCOPE WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED. Award will be made on all or none basis. DESC:
The University of California, Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory ("University" or "LBNL") requests a proposal for Shuttle Services, in accordance with the RFP, Sample Subcontract and other enclosures attached to this FedBizOps solicitation.

This solicitation is governed by procurement policies and procedures established under the University's Prime Contract No. DE-AC02-05CH11231 with the U.S. Government, represented by the Department of Energy (DOE), for management and operation of LBNL. Proposals submitted will be treated as offers and any resulting award(s) will be a subcontract under the University's Prime Contract.


Timeline of Events
Pre-Bid Meeting - May 23, 2019 10:00am-12:00pm

Offeror Questions Due- May 30, 2019 11:59pm

Proposals Due - July 12, 2019, no later than 3:00 p.m. Pacific Time


1.1 Estimated Term
It is expected the Subcontract will be performed over a period of 2 years and will include option years.

1.2 Notice of Small Business Set-Aside
Proposals are solicited exclusively from small business concerns. Any proposals from offerors that are not small business concerns will not be considered, and any award(s) resulting from this solicitation will only be made to a small business concern. Large businesses must partner with a small business concern to take part in this solicitation process.

1.3 NAICS Code and Small Business Size Standard
This is a 100% small business set aside under the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code 485410, School and Employee Bus Transportation. The corresponding small business size standard for this acquisition is annual receipts of $15 million or less.

Please see attached documents for further information regarding this solicitation.

DESC:
PLEASE REVIEW MOST RECENTLY PROVIDED DOCUMENTS FOR ALL UPDATES REGARDING THIS SOLICITATION. THE LINK FOR AMRDEC FILE DOWNLOAD WILL EXPIRE AFTER 48 HOURS FROM THE TIME THE AMRDEC NOTICE IS SENT.

Solicitation for W912GB19R0018

Firm-Fixed-Price (FFP), Stand Alone (C-Type) for the construction of the Long Term Equipment Storage and Maintenance Complex (LTESM-C) at Powidz Air Base, Poland

This announcement constitutes a formal solicitation with full details, including a response deadline, statement of work, Instructions to Offerors, the Evaluation Factors/Basis for Award, Technical Specifications, and Drawings.

OFFERORS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR MONITORING THIS WEBSITE FOR CHANGES TO THIS NOTICE.

1. PROJECT TITLE: Long Term Equipment Storage and Maintenance Complex (LTESM-C)

2. AGENCY: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) Europe District (NAU)

3. NAICS: 236220 - Construction of Buildings

4. PLACE OF PERFORMANCE: Powidz Air Base, Poland

5. SOLICITATION NUMBER: W912GB19R0018

6. TYPE OF CONTRACT: Firm-Fixed-Price (FFP), Stand Alone (C-Type) contract

7. TYPE OF SET-ASIDE: This acquisition will be an unrestricted action under full and open competitive conditions, subject to certain restrictions under the National Competitive Bidding Plus (NCB+) procedures: namely, this acquisition is open to all eligible firms registered and incorporated in a North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) member nation. Only firms from the 29 NATO countries will be permitted to participate as part of this project to include the prime contractor, sub-contractor(s), and manufacturers. None of the work, including labor and services, shall be performed by other than firms from within the 29 NATO member nations. Additionally, no materials or items of equipment to include identifiable sub-assemblies shall be manufactured or assembled by a firm other than from within the 29 NATO member nations. Small and Small Disadvantaged Business requirements are waived for this project due to its location Outside of the Contiguous United States (OCONUS).

8. DESCRIPTION OF WORK: The work includes the construction of the facilities located at the Long Term Equipment Storage Maintenance Complex (LTESM-C) on Powidz Air Base, Poland. The site is approximately 39-hectares and is located in a remote area. It is anticipated that a man-camp may be required for this project along with a dedicated concrete batch plant. a competitive negotiation using the best value tradeoff process, resulting in a FFP contract award to a single offeror who demonstrates the best value to the Government, considering all non-price (technical) and price factors.

9. SELECTION PROCESS: The acquisition strategy is a competitive negotiation using the best value tradeoff process, resulting in a FFP contract award to a single offeror who demonstrates the best value to the Government, considering all non-price (technical) and price factors.

10. CONTRACT MAGNITUDE: Estimated magnitude of construction is between $100,000,000 and $250,000,000.

11. SITE VISIT/PRE-PROPOSAL CONFERENCE: The pre-proposal conference and site visit official date, time, and location information are provided in the solicitation. The registration period for this event is CLOSED. An on-site passport check will be required prior to admittance into the conference and site visit. Additionally, this event will be conducted in English only. No translation or hardcopies of the presentation will be provided.

12. SPECIAL SAM NOTICE: Please take notice that SAM (www.sam.gov) has a new entity registration requirement that firms must submit an "original, signed notarized letter identifying the authorized Entity Administrator for the entity associated with the Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) number before the registration will be activated." This applies to all new entity registrations and all entity registration renewals, effective April 29, 2018. Further information behind this new requirement is posted to the General Services Administration's (GSA) announcement page at https://www.gsa.gov/about-us/organization/federal-acquisition-service/office-of-systems-management/integrated-award-environment-iae/sam-update-updated-july-11-2018. Please also refer to Federal Service Desk's (FSD) instructions on how to comply with this new requirement. Offerors are reminded that this solicitation will include the provision FAR 52.204-7 SAM and FAR 52.212-1 Instructions to Offerors--Commercial Items, and the resulting award will include the clause 52.212-4 Contract Terms and Conditions--Commercial Items. These provisions/clauses require all contractors to register and maintain an active SAM entity registration in order to be eligible for contract awards, as prescribed by the regulation at FAR Subpart 4.11. In order to eligible for the contract award resulting from this solicitation, Offerors are advised to take immediate action to ensure your SAM entity registration is current and/or will be current at the time of proposal receipt by this contracting office.

13. SOLICITATION DOCUMENT ACCESS REQUEST AND RELEASE: The Solicitation is restricted to only firms from the twenty-nine (29) North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) member nations. In order to receive access to the solicitation documents, your firm must have a Dun and Bradstreet Number (DUNS), Commercial and Government Entity (CAGE) code  or NATO Commercials and Government Entity (NCAGE) code, be registered as a vendor in FBO, and be registered in SAM (see above). You will not be able to access the documents otherwise. Offerors shall access the FBO announcement using their FBO login, and request authorized access to the announcement in order to download the solicitation documents. Access to the documents will NOT be granted to any firm or individual who is not registered and/or incorporated in a NATO member nation. To confirm this, the Government will check the DUNS information in SAM prior to approval of the document access request.

14. DISTRIBUTION STATEMENT/CLASSIFICATION:  Distribution authorized to U.S. Government Agencies and their contractors for protection of need to know For Official Use Only (FOUO) information. Other requests shall be referred to the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Europe District Project Management and Security Points of Contact. The FOUO and NATO distribution/classification briefings are provided as part of the solicitation documents.

15. POINT-OF-CONTACT: The USACE NAU Contracting Office will be the sole point-of-contact for this solicitation. The Primary Contracting Point of Contact for this solicitation is Contract Specialist, Ms. Whittni Hiscox, whittni.c.hiscox@usace.army.mil

Pre-Solicitation Site Visit Information:
A pre-solicitation site visit for this requirement is planned for 26-27 June 2019. The tour is anticipated to run from 0800-1630 local time on 26 June and 0800-1600 local time on 27 June including a Q&A session at the end of each day's tour.

The suspense date/time for submission of RSVPs has passed; no further RSVPs will be accepted.

We will meet at HAFB building 383 at 0800 local time both days. Directions to building 383 and a tentative itinerary are attached.

All attendees must ride on the Government provided tour bus; personal vehicles will not be allowed on the site visit. Capacity is limited to 44 attendees including Government representatives.

Draft Solicitation Number: W91238-19-R-0050

Draft Title: Optimized Remediation Contract for Hill AFB, UT

This is a SOURCES SOUGHT SYNOPSIS for MARKET RESEARCH only. This announcement seeks information from industry, which will be used for preliminary planning purposes. No proposals are being requested or accepted with this synopsis. THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION FOR PROPOSALS AND NO CONTRACT SHALL BE AWARDED FROM THIS SYNOPSIS. NO SOLICITATION, SPECIFICATIONS, OR DRAWINGS ARE AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME, OTHER THAN WHAT IS POSTED WITH THIS NOTICE.

Responses are being sought from qualified SMALL and OTHER THAN SMALL business concerns possessing the technical/management expertise to execute the work requirements. The required work elements include, but may not be limited to the following: environmental remediation activities including environmental services, minor construction, and A&E services at Hill AFB.  The attached Draft Performance Work Statement (PWS) dated 30 November 2018 defines the scope of Environmental Remediation activities to achieve performance objectives at 23 Installation Restoration Program (IRP) sites and two (2) Military Munitions Response Program (MMRP) sites. The resulting contract out of this solicitation will be for a ten (10) – year period. The resulting contract type is expected to be a Firm-Fixed Price.

The purpose of this synopsis is to gain knowledge of interest, capabilities and qualifications of various members of industry, Large and Small Business Communities. The Government must ensure there is adequate competition among the potential pool of responsible contractors.

This procurement is for:

1.            Services

2.            NAICS Code: 562910 – Environmental Remediation Services with Small Business size standard of                               *750 Employees (updated)

3.            Business Size Standard: To be determined after responses to the sources sought are received and evaluated.

4.            In accordance with FAR 52.219-14(c)(1), Limitation on Sub-Contracting: "Services." "At least 50 percent of the cost of contract performance incurred for personnel shall be expended for employees of the concern."

 

Prior Government contract work is not required for submitting a response under this sources sought synopsis.

The official Synopsis citing the solicitation number will be issued on Federal Business Opportunities www.fbo.gov and inviting firms to register electronically to receive a copy of the solicitation when it is issued.  The Government has yet to make a determination as to the acquisition source. It is anticipated that this acquisition will be awarded utilizing a Request for Proposal (RFP) Best-value Trade-off acquisition type.

Firm's response to this Synopsis shall be limited to 10 pages and shall include the following information:

-          Firm's name, address, point of contact, phone number, and e-mail address.

-          Firm's CAGE and DUNS numbers if applicable.

-          Firm's interest in bidding on the solicitation when it is issued.

-          Firm’s Capability Sheet as it relates to this project

-          Provide Example Projects: The firm should provide a brief description of the project, customer name, timeliness of performance, customer satisfaction, and dollar value of the project .

-          Provide at least one (1) example project demonstrating your firms ability and experience in managing work at various locations throughout a wide/multi-state geographical distance if applicable.

-          Provide three (4) to five (5) example projects demonstrating experience of work similar to that described within the description provided above.

-          Firm's Business Size category: Large Business, Small Business, HUB Zone, Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business, Women Owned, or 8(a).

-          Firm's Joint Venture information if applicable - existing and potential

 

Interested Firms shall respond to this Sources Sought Synopsis no later than 8:00 AM, Friday,  29 March 2019.

All interested firms must be registered in SAM.gov to be eligible for award of Government contracts.

AWARDEE: SKOOKUM EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, 4525 AUTO CENTER WAY, BREMERTON, WA 983124312 US
DESC: CEHNC will provide critical Sustainment, Restoration, and Modernization Services in support of the Fort Riley, Kansas locations by awarding a firm-fixed-price contract using FAR 8.704(a)(2)(i) with a performance period of one year. In accordance with FAR 8.7, "Acquisition from Nonprofit Agencies Employing People Who Are Blind or Severely Disabled," agencies shall satisfy requirements for services from the Procurement List maintained by the Committee for Purchase from People Who Are Blind or Severely Disabled. Research of the Ability One database determined that these service are currently on the Procurement List and these services are currently being performed by a registered Ability One Program vendor ‘Skookum Educational Programs'. Consequently, Ability One is a mandatory source for this service and is therefore selected for continued performance.  This is a non-personal services contract to provide DPW support services for Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance (ITM) work; Demand Maintenance Order (DMO) work; and Sustainment, Restoration, and Modernization (SRM) services.  The Government will not exercise any supervision or control over the contract service providers performing the services herein.  Such contract service providers shall be accountable solely to the Contractor who, in turn is responsible to the Government.  The Contractor shall provide all management, supervision, labor, materials, supplies, tools, equipment, communications devices, transportation, and fuel necessary to provide DPW support services for ITM work on specified elevators and lifts, generators, engine-driven fire pumps (fire pumps), air compressors, cranes and hoists and electronic lock systems; DMO work on specified elevators and lifts, generators, fire pumps, air compressors, cranes, hoists, and electronic lock systems, on all infrastructure including facilities, structures, grounds, improvements, appurtenances, and associated plumbing, HVAC, electrical, and utility service systems in all designated facilities; and SRM services on all infrastructure including facilities, structures, grounds, improvements, appurtenances, and associated plumbing, HVAC, electrical, and utility service systems in all designated facilities as defined in this PWS and the Technical Exhibits and  All work performed by the Contractor shall be performed in accordance with all this PWS, applicable laws, regulations, Army standards, instructions, and commercial practices.
